|stockos = |exp_if_types = |exp_sim_num = |exp_pcmcia_num = |exp_expcard_num = |exp_minipci_num = |exp_minipcie_num = |exp_usb_num = |exp_cf_num = |exp_sdmmc_num = |exp_ide_num = |exp_ata_num = |exp_sata_num = |exp_esata_num = |exp_parallel = |exp_sfp_num = |exp_M.2 = |exp_hdmi_num = |usb_hub = |pwr_volt_type = VDC |pwr_vdc = 12 |pwr_amp_dc = 1 |pwr_conn = barrel |pwr_barrel_outer = |pwr_barrel_inner = |pwr_barrel_len = |pwr_pol = |serial = |jtag = |specialfeat = |flags = |addchip = |802dot11_protocols = bgn |defaulip = 192.168.1.1 |defaultlogin = admin |defaultpass = password |defaultssid = NETGEAR |defaultssid_regex = ^NETGEAR$ |default_ch = |manuf = Foxconn |manuf_model = |manuf_rev = |is_manuf = No |tpfirmware = |availability = |eoldate = |fccapprovdate = 11/16/2009 |estreldate = |estprice = |upc = |ean = |dx_sku = |newegg = |asin = |asin_country = |asin2 = |asin_country2 = |countrymanuf = China, Vietnam |buttons = |led = |dimensions = 28 x 175 x 118 mm (1.1 x 6.9 x 4.7 in) |weight = |wi1_if_name = |rad1chip1cpu = true |rad1oui = |rad1_ant_conn = |rad1txchains = 1 |rad1rxchains = 1 |rad1sstreams = 1 |rad1stand = IEEE 802.11b/g/n |rad1n = 150 |rad1g = 54 |rad1b = 11 |rad1freq = 2.4 |rad1correv = |rad1cap = }}{{TIDTOC|embedded}} ==Overview== The same hardware is also used for the WNR1000v3. The device was originally locked to 802.11b/g speeds only (despite being single-stream 802.11n capable), but the latest Netgear firmware enabled 802.11n capability for the device. Manuf. by Foxconn / Hon Hai / Ambit Per the manual, the default SSID is '''NETGEAR'''. serial flash chip device! Same HW as [[Netgear WNR1000v3|WNR1000 v3.0]] ==Links of Interest== [http://www.dd-wrt.com/phpBB2/viewtopic.php?t=65317 On the DD-WRT forums], [http://www.dd-wrt.com/phpBB2/viewtopic.php?t=68621 and again], [http://www.dd-wrt.com/phpBB2/viewtopic.php?p=449309 and again]
[http://tomatousb.org/forum/t-308157 TomatoUSB and the WGR614v10] ==Pictures==
